sentence.Network_en: Jimmy turned maudlin after three drinks.

sentence.Network_cn: 他变得沉醉了,不拘束了, 几乎看不清牌,也坐不端正了.

sentence.Network_en: Mr. Carrey may be consciously steering his movies toward maudlin pop psychology.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a noun denoting Mary Magdalen): from Old French Madeleine, from Church Latin Mag-dalena (see magdalen). The current sense derives from allusion to pictures of Mary Magdalen weeping

entry.tran: （尤指酒后）伤感的，多愁善感的
entry.def: If you describe someone as maudlin, you mean that they are being sad and sentimental in a foolish way, perhaps because of drinking alcohol.

example.ex: Jimmy turned maudlin after three drinks.

entry.tran: (歌曲、书、电影等)伤感的，凄哀的
entry.def: If you describe a song, book, or film as maudlin, you are criticizing it for being very sentimental.

example.ex: ...the most maudlin song of all time.
example.tran: 有史以来最伤感的歌曲

example.ex: ...a hugely entertaining (if overlong and maudlin) movie.
example.tran: (尽管超长又伤感但)极其引人入胜的影片
